title: Firefox does serach Google and give this error on network under developer SSL_ERROR_PROTOCOL_VERSION_ALERT
content:
Hello Everyone,

I am getting this issue where when I Search google.com from my Firefox on mac book (Big Sur OS) it doesn't work, Eg, I type google and press enter it doesn't go for search it stays there as it is no change no error, from Developer tool, under network I get this error when I hit the google.com "SSL_ERROR_PROTOCOL_VERSION_ALERT" does any have a solution for this.
creator: nimish.vora

title: Firefox deletes cookies and site data/settings upon closing.
content: So the issue started happening after firefox updated to version 91. Now every time i restart the browser, all site settings are reset. That includes acknowledging new machine sign-ins into gmail (every single time even after choosing to remember the device), entering verification codes sent to my email to sign into other websites that I never signed out of before closing the browser. Some websites like youtube and twitch I have to set up over and over again. This is extremely annoying and I've never had these issues before the update. I checked all the settings for clearing data upon closing the browser and none are enabled just like they have never been. I do not want to reinstall firefox as I have a load of personalized tweaks done that I cant even remember. Any suggestions?
creator: alex7537

title: Native tab groups (Please!)
content:
As the title says- Please bring back native tab groups! :)

Native tab groups in Chrome make my life immeasurably easier- I know it may seem like a minor feature, but as someone with adult ADHD, I can honestly easy tab grouping within the tab bar itself enables me to: 

 * Context switch orders of magnitude faster  * Undertake certain tasks (mainly research-heavy) that are extremely challenging otherwise, due to clutter and distraction.

I know there are alternatives, but they simply don't stack up to simple, native support:

  • 3rd party Add-ons - I've tried Tab Stash, it worked OK.. but hidden tabs + a separate menu system to access them is not comparable to native grouping within the tab bar. Also, You have to give unreasonable access to extensions for this (general issue with granularity of permissions).
  • Multiple windows/desktops - I used to work like this, but windows cannot be named, and even if they could having many desktop programs open runs into the same organization problem.


Honestly, I've been using Firefox for 10-15 years, even when seeing chrome is often faster and more stable - mostly for ideologically, going for Mozilla over Google.

But this one feature brings me so much value I feel I have no choice but to switch. I really hope this gets implemented so I can come back!
creator: SuperSpasm

title: can not exit full screen mode
content: can not exit full screen mode neither F11 nor the "Zoom" menu option works for me restarting Firefox doesn't help either it's Win-10 Firefox 91.0.1 (64-bit)

title: How to automatically sync Firefox theme upon sign-in?
content: By default, it seems that Firefox sync does not have a 'global theme' option, and that the themes need to be enabled manually on every PC one logs in to (although the themes used on other devices do show up in the Manage Your Themes section, they are disabled). Is there a way of automatically enabling a theme when one signs in to a new PC? If so, please tell me so I could save the hassle of around of two-three clicks.
creator: aryan.r.jha

title: All extensions pop up every time I sign in to Firefox account
content:
I work on a university lab PC, which I need to sign in to and out of (including deleting all saved data and extensions) every day. I have Firefox sync enabled (including extensions, because I require them).

However every time I sign in, the message pages of all the synced extensions pop up as tabs, wasting around three minutes of my time (I've to wait for them to open first because if I try to type anything in my search engine, another tab opens, switching the cursor to this newly opened tab. Plus it is annoying to manually close around a dozen tabs).

How to disable such 'messages' from opening automatically upon the first sync?
creator: aryan.r.jha

title: Terminate account that was created in error
content:
I found out way too late that I had used the wrong email address to log into my Firefox account and have accidentally created a second account that I want to cancel.

The wrong email address is one of the email addresses I use, just not the one I use for my Firefox account.

I activated the Firefox account that was accidentally created before I realized I had used the wrong email address.

title: firefox hangs on sites
content:
Hellow,

Since updating the latest firefox version 91.01 it has considerably slowed down browsing speed to an impossible crawl. The task manager shows the update as permanently on, sucking 100% resources. There´s something not right when it does this, and is becoming a bad habit of constantly refreshing firefox to get sensible operation. 

It started by installing a clear cache which helped as firefox also hangs when connecting to the internet as a result it goes off-line at random times. Barely ideal.

Is it worth rolling back to an earlier version that is more stable ? Any other users got debugging suggestions ?

rJ

title: Moving profile to older version of Firefox
content: Due to switching to a Linux distro with a slightly older version of Firefox, Firefox is complaining about the profile I copied in. The profile's compatibility.ini file says LastVersion=91.0.20210812023606/20210812023606. The current Firefox version is 90.0.2. Has the structure of the profile changed between these versions? If not, what's the best way to alter compatibility.ini?
creator: barry.abel

title: Firefox.exe not running continuously - windows kiosk usage
content:
Hello there

I am using Firefox as a windows kiosk application. One feature of this windows functionality is the restart of the kiosk app as soon as it gets closed.

Sadly this detection causes problems with firefox as the firefox.exe does not seem to be running continuously during startup.

Therefore the eshell (which manages the windows kiosk) tries to restart firefox and therefore a new instance is opened.

I don't know what causes this behaviour of firefox, maybe the Updater? If you start firefox via cmd and with the /wait flag it also does not seem to run continuously and the scirpt proceeds before firefox is closed again.

Firefox was installed with a msi installer and it is on the ESR channel.

Is there any way to fix this? Thank you beforehand!
creator: alessio.dilello

title: Firefox on iMac M1 breaks pages in main user account, but works fine in Guest account?
content:

https://i.imgur.com/NGbeKXX.png

The pages work fine in Safari, so it's not the websites and it's not the whole computer. Here's the weirder thing--if I log into the Mac's guest account, Firefox loads the websites just fine. Any ideas? Is it a security or privacy setting on my main account?

title: Firefox needs a much better profile management system
content:
The feedback page is useless and I don't see any way to contact Mozilla so this will probably go unviewed and be more of a rant but Firefox absolutely needs a much better profile management and back system. Particularly there should be a mandatory step to backup a current profile before updating. Today I updated Firefox not by choice, for some reason my PC decided that a single click was a double click. So the latest version created a brand new profile I assume because I already had Firefox open. I am beyond rage right now because I just spent the last half hour trying to find my correct profile in my user data because for some insane reason Firefox decided to create two new profiles.

I manually backed up my profile data but it's incredibly stupid that A) the profile naming is gibberish and B) I had to do that in the first place.8
creator: njdev

title: Recovering Past Projects From Thimble
content: Good evening. I was direct messaging you all in order to gain some insight on old Thimble projects. Assisting these students would be even more accomplishable if I had these past projects. Unfortunately, I don’t remember being informed about the shutting down of Thimble. Therefore, I wasn’t able to export my past projects to Glitch such as many other users. I’ve already created two Glitch accounts in order to see if it’s still possible to transfer information, but you all seem to have no form of direct customer service contact. Additionally, I've sent sent an email and direct message to Mozilla but received no response. I've been trying to recover my projects for the past two days and a while ago, so it would be greatly appreciated if I can please still recover my past projects! Thanks!
